items.title: ‘Gradually then suddenly’: Is AI job displacement following this pattern?
items.description: Many technological shifts have coincided with economic downturns. Will 2025 be the year AI not only augments jobs but starts to replace them?

items.title: The open-source AI debate: Why selective transparency poses a serious risk
items.description: It is misleading to call AI open source when no one can look at, experiment with and understand each element that went into creating it.

items.title: Less is more: UC Berkeley and Google unlock LLM potential through simple sampling
items.description: With multiple sampling and self-verification, Gemini 1.5 Pro can outperform o1-preview in reasoning tasks.

items.title: Small models as paralegals: LexisNexis distills models to build AI assistant
items.description: LexisNexis fine-tuned Mistral models to build its Protege AI assistant, relying on distilled and small models for its AI platform.

items.title: OpenAI’s new voice AI model gpt-4o-transcribe lets you add speech to your existing text apps in seconds
items.description: Three, all new proprietary voice models called gpt-4o-transcribe, gpt-4o-mini-transcribe and gpt-4o-mini-tts.
